verses.roman:
etā bhagavato viṣṇor
ādityasya vibhūtayaḥ
smaratāṁ sandhyayor nṟṇāṁ
haranty aṁho dine dine

synonyms: etāḥ—these; bhagavataḥ—of the Personality of Godhead; viṣṇoḥ—Lord Viṣṇu; ādityasya—of the sun-god; vibhūtayaḥ—the opulences; smaratām—for those who remember; sandhyayoḥ—at the junctures of the day; nṟṇām—for such men; haranti—they take away; aṁhaḥ—sinful reactions; dine dine—day after day.
translation: All these personalities are the opulent expansions of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Viṣṇu, in the form of the sun-god. These deities take away all the sinful reactions of those who remember them each day at dawn and sunset.
